pr_title: HDDS-2929. Implement ofs://: temp directory mount

timeline.bodyText: Is it better to have a 'DEFAULT_USER' string to replace a null input?
timeline.author: timmylicheng

replies.bodyText:
Thanks for the review and comment.
Yeah good point. null here doesn't have have good readability.
Added new function getTempMountBucketNameOfCurrentUser() in 5ed5cfa
Initially I thought of overriding it but ended up adding a new function with a different name for even better code readability.
replies.author: smengcl

timeline.bodyText: Do you mean to comment a TODO here?
timeline.author: timmylicheng

timeline.bodyText: NIT. 'conf' may be a more consistent choice of naming in Ozone repo.
timeline.author: timmylicheng

replies.bodyText:
This is due to I put another conf in global. So IntelliJ is complaining this conf inside shadows the global conf in this function.
Anyway, will rename it.
replies.author: smengcl

timeline.message:
Implement simple client-side only version of temp mount.

1. An admin must create volume "tmp" with world access ACL before any user can use /tmp/
2. When a user is trying to write under /tmp/, a bucket with that user's name will be automatically created under volume "tmp"

(cherry picked from commit 53416c52717ad788516000831d2df96e171f4ba0)

Conflicts:
hadoop-ozone/integration-test/src/test/java/org/apache/hadoop/fs/ozone/TestRootedOzoneFileSystem.java
hadoop-ozone/ozonefs/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/fs/ozone/OFSPath.java

getBucket: Always create bucket if volumeStr matches "tmp". This implies that any operations that reads /tmp/ will also create bucket for that user. Tested in shell:

# Prep
bash-4.2$ ozone sh volume create tmp
bash-4.2$ ozone sh volume getacl tmp
[ {
  "type" : "USER",
  "name" : "hadoop",
  "aclScope" : "ACCESS",
  "aclList" : [ "ALL" ]
}, {
  "type" : "GROUP",
  "name" : "users",
  "aclScope" : "ACCESS",
  "aclList" : [ "ALL" ]
} ]
bash-4.2$ ozone sh volume setacl tmp -al world::all
Acl set successfully.
bash-4.2$ ozone sh volume getacl tmp
[ {
  "type" : "WORLD",
  "name" : "WORLD",
  "aclScope" : "ACCESS",
  "aclList" : [ "LIST", "ALL" ]
} ]

# Commands
bash-4.2$ HADOOP_USER_NAME=user2 ozone fs -ls ofs://om/tmp/
2020-02-20 12:02:08,931 [main] INFO rpc.RpcClient: Creating Bucket: tmp/user2
bash-4.2$ HADOOP_USER_NAME=user1 ozone fs -put README.md ofs://om/tmp/
2020-02-20 12:02:26,945 [main] INFO rpc.RpcClient: Creating Bucket: tmp/user1
bash-4.2$ HADOOP_USER_NAME=user1 ozone fs -ls ofs://om/tmp/
Found 1 items
-rw-rw-rw-   1 user1 user1       3813 2020-02-20 12:02 ofs://om/tmp/README.md
bash-4.2$ HADOOP_USER_NAME=user2 ozone fs -ls ofs://om/tmp/
(empty result, proves that user1 and user2 have separate temp bucket)

(cherry picked from commit dc512dcfad3bbc21f1e6e7119047edc6fd0afaf0)

getTempMountBucketName: Return MD5 hash of username instead to avoid invalid characters in username for a bucket name. e.g. om/om@EXAMPLE.COM

(cherry picked from commit e756323e3d8bf2cb29394bab838a7ca2e4a8118f)

Conflicts:
hadoop-ozone/ozonefs/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/fs/ozone/OFSPath.java

Remove unused imports.

(cherry picked from commit e83fdc4d0d663207ad957df1b8fbf7848d73e12c)

Add OFS impl in ozonesecure docker-config for manual testing and robot tests.

(cherry picked from commit 16eb066d57efd165111ada01c16dee3d25a7e904)
Expand test to check file creation/existence.
Add getTempMountBucketNameOfCurrentUser() to improve readability; improve comments.

timeline.bodyText: Do we create the tmp bucket even for read operation?
timeline.author: xiaoyuyao

replies.bodyText:
That's correct. This is my implementation decision.
I initially only create temp bucket for write, as you would expect. Then I found Hadoop FS file write operations calls getFileStatus beforehand.
replies.author: smengcl

replies.bodyText: After some discussion, we decide to let user create their temp bucket manually upon first use. i.e. ozone fs -mkdir ofs://om/tmp/
replies.author: smengcl

timeline.bodyText: How do we allow userA to access userB's tmp bucket? This may be needed for the ETL workload where an injest process run as user A and the process process run as user B.
timeline.author: xiaoyuyao
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -44,7 +48,7 @@
    * /vol1/buc2/dir3/key4  vol1           buc2           (empty)      dir3/key4
    * /vol1/buc2            vol1           buc2           (empty)      (empty)
    * /vol1                 vol1           (empty)        (empty)      (empty)
-   * /tmp/dir3/key4        tempVolume     tempBucket     tmp          dir3/key4
+   * /tmp/dir3/key4        tmp            <username>     tmp          dir3/key4

replies.bodyText:
As of now userA can't access userB's temp with ofs:// . Because OFSPath parses ofs://tmp/dir1/dir2 into
volume=tmp
bucketname=<USER_TEMP_BUCKET_NAME>
key(in bucket)=dir1/dir2
replies.author: smengcl

replies.bodyText:
I'm thinking of adding some .reserved like HDFS did to allow user to bypass the mount or add some options, if there is a need.
Anyway this may not fit in this jira.
replies.author: smengcl

replies.bodyText: agree, can you add the proposal to the design doc in the umbrella JIRA?
replies.author: xiaoyuyao

timeline.bodyText: why do we need to catch the exception here? This should not fail, if it does, the exception can bubble up directly.
timeline.author: xiaoyuyao

timeline.message: Don't create temp bucket for read operations; make getTempMountBucketNameOfCurrentUser throw.

timeline.bodyText: NIT: should we update the comment to match with the code?
timeline.author: xiaoyuyao
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -44,7 +48,7 @@
    * /vol1/buc2/dir3/key4  vol1           buc2           (empty)      dir3/key4
    * /vol1/buc2            vol1           buc2           (empty)      (empty)
    * /vol1                 vol1           (empty)        (empty)      (empty)
-   * /tmp/dir3/key4        tempVolume     tempBucket     tmp          dir3/key4
+   * /tmp/dir3/key4        tmp            <username>     tmp          dir3/key4

replies.bodyText: As discussed, will resolve in a follow up jira.
replies.author: smengcl

timeline.bodyText: NIT: Can we use the name directly to make it more user friendly? Given it is transparent to the ofs client access, I think it is OK as-is to avoid confliction.
timeline.author: xiaoyuyao

replies.bodyText:
As discussed, since other users' tmp buckets aren't visible to current user via ofs://. This could be addressed when the requirement of accessing other users' temp bucket happen.
And there are several related future improvements. Like:

Allowing users to access all volumes (that they have access to) via a special reserved path (e.g. ofs://om/.volumes/<volume_name>/.. or ofs://om/.reserved/..). Because at the moment, tmp mount is masking the existence of volume tmp in ofs:// because of the parsing logic in OFSPath.
Also, admins should be able to list all volumes, not just the ones they own.
Provide a utility in Ozone Shell to access the users' temp buckets conveniently for admins.
replies.author: smengcl
